item.title: Katie add a quote by Catherynne Valente
Katie add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Katie add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Dance like you're stamping on a human face forever, love like you've been in a serious car crash that minced the front of your brain, stab like no one can arrest you, and live like there's no such thing as God." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Katie add a quote by Catherynne Valente
item.description: "Stories...are like prayers. It does not matter when you begin, or when you end, only that you bend a knee and say the words." -- Catherynne Valente

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "What you risk reveals what you value." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Katie add a quote by Hans Christian Andersen
item.description: "Sharp knives seemed to cut her delicate feet, yet she hardly felt them, so deep was the pain in her heart. She could not forget that this was the last night she would ever see the one for whom she had left her home and family, had given up her beautiful voice, and had day by day endured unending torment, of which he knew nothing at all. An eternal night awaited her. " -- Hans Christian Andersen

item.title: Katie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Katie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Katie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Katie add a quote by China Miéville
item.description: "Fantasy and science fiction can be literal as well as allegorical and there’s nothing wrong with enjoying a monster like a giant squid for what it is, as well as searching for metaphor." -- China Miéville

item.title: Katie add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Gatsby believed in the green light, the orgastic future that year by year recedes before us. It eluded us then, but that's no matter - to-morrow we will run faster, stretch out our arms farther ... And one fine morning ---" -- F. Scott Fitzgerald
